**My Hand:**
1. 7 of Spades (+7 chips)
2. 5 of Spades (+5 chips)
3. 7 of Hearts (+7 chips)
4. 6 of Hearts (+6 chips)
5. 7 of Clubs (+7 chips)
6. Ace of Diamonds (+11 chips)
7. Jack of Diamonds (+10 chips, face card)
8. 10 of Diamonds (+10 chips)

**My Jokers:**
1. Smiley Face - +5 Mult per scored face card
2. Square Joker - +4 Chips if played hand has exactly 4 cards (currently 4 Chips)
3. Red Card - +3 Mult when booster pack skipped (currently +0 Mult)
4. Blue Joker - +2 Chips for each remaining card in deck (currently +54 Chips)

**Possible Hands:**
- Three of a Kind with 7s: positions 1, 3, 5 (7♠, 7♥, 7♣)
- Diamonds flush potential: positions 6, 7, 8 (need 5 for flush, only have 3)
- Hearts pair potential: positions 3, 4 (7♥, 6♥ - not a pair)

I need 345 more chips. Let me calculate what I can get from a Three of a Kind:

**Three of a Kind with 7s (positions 1, 3, 5):**


Base chips of 70 plus the three 7s themselves gives 91, and with the Blue Joker adding 54 more, that's 145 total chips. The multiplier stays at 7 since none of my jokers activate—no face cards for Smiley Face, only three cards so Square Joker doesn't trigger, and Red Card isn't active. This yields 1,015 chips, which falls short of the 1,200 needed.

However, I could play a fourth card to activate Square Joker. Adding a Jack to the three 7s would give me 149 chips (the original 145 plus 4 from Square Joker), and now Smiley Face triggers because the Jack counts as a face card, boosting my multiplier to 12 instead of 7.

Wait—I need to reconsider. Looking back at my earlier hand, the pair of 10s didn't trigger Smiley Face even with face cards present, which suggests only cards that are part of the hand type itself count for triggering effects. So the Jack wouldn't activate Smiley Face if it's not part of the Three of a Kind.

Without Smiley Face, playing four cards gives me just 149 chips × 7 multiplier = 1,043 chips, which still clears the 1,200 threshold but is less efficient than my three-card option.

Playing just the three 7s is cleaner: 145 × 7 = 1,015 chips, bringing my total to 1,870 chips. That's well above what I need, so I'll go with positions 1, 3, 5 for the Three of a Kind.

# Available Commands
The possible commands in Balatro are all composed of a single word specifying the action, followed by any necessary positional arguments, which are lists of integers.
Note: all position arguments are 1-indexed.

The following commands are available in your current game state.
use_consumable <consumeable_position> <target_card_position1> <target_card_position2> ... <target_card_positionN> - Use a consumeable from the consumeables section. The first position argument is the position within your consumables inventory of the consumable you'd like to use. Subsequent position arguments specify the cards in hand that the consumeable will be used on, if that consumeable requires targets.
sell_consumable <consumeable_position> - Sell a consumeable from the consumeables section.
rearrange_jokers <joker1> <joker2> ... <jokerN> - Rearrange the list of currently owned jokers. Every index in the list of current jokers must be present, i.e. if there are 5 jokers, the indices 1-5 must be present.
sell_joker <joker_position> - Sell a joker from the jokers section.
buy_card <card_position> - Buy a card from the card section. Individual Joker cards are also bought from the card section.
buy_booster <booster_pack_position> - Buy a booster pack from the booster pack section.
buy_voucher <voucher_position> - Buy a voucher from the voucher section.
buy_and_use_consumable <consumable_position> - Buy a consumable type card (Tarot, Planet, Spectral) from the card section and use it immediately. Cannot do this if the consumable requires target hand cards.
round_select - Finish shopping and go to the round select screen.
reroll_shop - Spends the reroll cost to reroll the cards section of the shop.
